ArtifactExistence.DamageDestroyDisableDi.definition: The damaging, but not destruction, of a thing (nb: use Disable or Dismantle instead for those specific kinds of damage)
Disabling the expected functioning of a mechanical device, or software, for example defusing or removing a fuse from an explosive
ArtifactExistence.DamageDestroyDisableDi.template: <arg1> disabled or defused <arg2> using <arg3> instrument in <arg4> place

ArtifactExistence.DamageDestroyDisableDi.definition: Disassembling an artifact in such a way that it could be reassembled
ArtifactExistence.DamageDestroyDisableDi.template: <arg1> dismantled <arg2> using <arg3> instrument into <arg4> components in <arg5> place

ArtifactExistence.DamageDestroyDisableDi.definition: The damaging or destruction of a thing
ArtifactExistence.DamageDestroyDisableDi.template: <arg1> damaged or destroyed <arg2> using <arg3> instrument in <arg4> place

ArtifactExistence.ManufactureAssemble.Un.definition: Physical action of building, assembling, manufacturing, putting things together, mixing, etc. (does not include the creation of intellectual property)
ArtifactExistence.ManufactureAssemble.Un.template: <arg1> manufactured or assembled or produced <arg2> from <arg3> components using <arg4> at <arg5> place

Cognitive.IdentifyCategorize.Unspecified.definition: The act of establishing the identity of an entity or event, or establishing the relevant category that an entity or event belongs to, such as being a suspect or a target or an attack

Cognitive.Inspection.SensoryObserve.definition: An observation or inspection event, with any target of inspection

Cognitive.Research.Unspecified.definition: Explicit mention of researching the answer to a question by analyzing literature or testing hypotheses through experiments or reviewing opinions from experts in a field

Cognitive.TeachingTrainingLearning.Unspe.definition: The action of teaching a person or animal a particular skill or type of behavior, where the learner does not have complete mastery of the skill until the end
Cognitive.TeachingTrainingLearning.Unspe.template: <arg1> taught <arg2> field of knowledge to <arg3> using <arg4> at <arg5> institution in <arg6> place

Conflict.Attack.DetonateExplode.definition: Exploding a device intentionally, as an assault on a person or for physical damage, for the purposes of attack (including bombings)
Conflict.Attack.DetonateExplode.template: <arg1> detonated or exploded <arg4> explosive device using <arg3> to attack <arg2> target at <arg5> place

Conflict.Attack.Unspecified.definition: An attack event, a violent physical act causing harm or damage

Conflict.Defeat.Unspecified.definition: Defeat in a conflict or an election, but not a game-style competition

Conflict.Demonstrate.DemonstrateWithViol.definition: A demonstration, march, protest, riot, or political gathering that includes violent acts by any participant (including police)
Conflict.Demonstrate.DemonstrateWithViol.template: <arg1> was in a demonstration involving violence for <arg4> topic with <arg3> visual display against <arg5> at <arg6> place, with potential involvement of <arg2> police or military

Conflict.Demonstrate.Unspecified.definition: A demonstration, march, protest, or political gathering
Conflict.Demonstrate.Unspecified.template: <arg1> was in a demonstration for <arg4> topic with <arg3> visual display against <arg5> at <arg6> place, with potential involvement of <arg2> police or military

Contact.Contact.Broadcast.definition: An event where a participant(s) communicates in a one-way communication without any expectation of response
Contact.Contact.Broadcast.template: <arg1> communicated to <arg2> about <arg4> topic using <arg3> at <arg5> place (one-way communication)

Contact.Contact.Correspondence.definition: An event where two or more participants communicate in a way that is not in person (e.g. email, phone, etc.)
Contact.Contact.Correspondence.template: <arg1> communicated remotely with <arg2> about <arg4> topic using <arg3> at <arg5> place

Contact.Contact.Meet.definition: An event where two or more participants communicate in person
Contact.Contact.Meet.template: <arg1> met face-to-face with <arg2> about <arg3> topic at <arg4> place

Contact.Contact.Unspecified.definition: An event where two or more participants communicate over any medium, where the context does not distinguish the nature of the contact or whether the communication is in person or remote
Contact.Contact.Unspecified.template: <arg1> communicated with <arg2> about <arg3> topic at <arg4> place (document does not specify in person or not, or one-way or not)

Contact.Prevarication.Broadcast.definition: A one-way communication that is knowingly untrue or vague about the truth
Contact.Prevarication.Broadcast.template: <arg1> communicated to <arg2> about <arg4> topic using <arg3> at <arg5> place (one-way communication)

Contact.Prevarication.Correspondence.definition: A two-way communication that is knowingly untrue or vague about the truth, not in person
Contact.Prevarication.Correspondence.template: <arg1> communicated remotely with <arg2> about <arg4> topic using <arg3> at <arg5> place

Contact.Prevarication.Meet.definition: A communication that is knowingly untrue or vague about the truth, made in person
Contact.Prevarication.Meet.template: <arg1> met face-to-face with <arg2> about <arg3> topic at <arg4> place

Contact.Prevarication.Unspecified.definition: Any communication over any medium where the communicator intentionally deceives the addressee or continue an ongoing deception, either by knowingly conveying false information, or conveying information with the intent of the addressee drawing the wrong conclusion, or omitting information.
Contact.Prevarication.Unspecified.template: <arg1> communicated with <arg2> about <arg3> topic at <arg4> place (document does not specify in person or not, or one-way or not)

Contact.RequestCommand.Broadcast.definition: A statement making a request, appeal, command, or order via one-way communication
Contact.RequestCommand.Broadcast.template: <arg1> communicated to <arg2> about <arg4> topic using <arg3> at <arg5> place (one-way communication)

Contact.RequestCommand.Correspondence.definition: A statement making a request, appeal, command, or order via two-way communication, not in person
Contact.RequestCommand.Correspondence.template: <arg1> communicated remotely with <arg2> about <arg4> topic using <arg3> at <arg5> place

Contact.RequestCommand.Meet.definition: A statement making a request, appeal, command, or order made in person
Contact.RequestCommand.Meet.template: <arg1> met face-to-face with <arg2> about <arg3> topic at <arg4> place

Contact.RequestCommand.Unspecified.definition: A statement making a request, appeal, command, or order, where the context does not distinguish whether the communication is one-way or two-way, or whether it is in person or remote
Contact.RequestCommand.Unspecified.template: <arg1> communicated with <arg2> about <arg3> topic at <arg4> place (document does not specify in person or not, or one-way or not)

Contact.ThreatenCoerce.Broadcast.definition: A statement offering threat or coercion via one-way communication
Contact.ThreatenCoerce.Broadcast.template: <arg1> communicated to <arg2> about <arg4> topic using <arg3> at <arg5> place (one-way communication)

Contact.ThreatenCoerce.Correspondence.definition: A statement offering threat or coercion via two-way communication, not in person
Contact.ThreatenCoerce.Correspondence.template: <arg1> communicated remotely with <arg2> about <arg4> topic using <arg3> at <arg5> place

Contact.ThreatenCoerce.Meet.definition: A statement offering threat or coercion made in person
Contact.ThreatenCoerce.Meet.template: <arg1> met face-to-face with <arg2> about <arg3> topic at <arg4> place

Contact.ThreatenCoerce.Unspecified.definition: A statement offering threat or coercion, where the context does not distinguish whether the communication is one-way or two-way, or whether it is in person or remote
Contact.ThreatenCoerce.Unspecified.template: <arg1> communicated with <arg2> about <arg3> topic at <arg4> place (document does not specify in person or not, or one-way or not)

Control.ImpedeInterfereWith.Unspecified.definition: Explicit mention of an entity knowingly placing obstacles, not necessarily physical, that raise difficulties with respect to the occurrence of a taggable, non-Movement event or process
Control.ImpedeInterfereWith.Unspecified.template: <arg1> impeded or interfered with <arg2> event at <arg3> place

Disaster.Crash.Unspecified.definition: Vehicular collision or the crashing of any type of vehicle
Disaster.Crash.Unspecified.template: <arg1> person in <arg2> vehicle crashed into <arg3> at <arg4> place

Disaster.DiseaseOutbreak.Unspecified.definition: Explicit mentions of an outbreak of a disease in an area, region, or country
Disaster.DiseaseOutbreak.Unspecified.template: <arg1> disease broke out among <arg2> victims or population at <arg3> place

Disaster.FireExplosion.Unspecified.definition: A damaging fire or explosion, either natural or caused but without the intent of attacking
Disaster.FireExplosion.Unspecified.template: <arg1> caught fire or exploded from <arg2> instrument at <arg3> place

GenericCrime.GenericCrime.GenericCrime.definition: For use as the crime argument in a Justice event when the crime event is not taggable as any other annotation ontology event type
GenericCrime.GenericCrime.GenericCrime.template: <arg1> committed a crime against <arg2> at <arg3> place

Justice.Acquit.Unspecified.definition: An acquit event occurs whenever a trial ends but fails to produce a conviction, including cases where the charges are dropped by the prosecutor
Justice.Acquit.Unspecified.template: <arg1> court or judge acquitted <arg2> of <arg3> crime in <arg4> place

Justice.ArrestJailDetain.Unspecified.definition: The detention, taking hostage, kidnapping, arrest, or jailing of an individual by government or non-government actors
Justice.ArrestJailDetain.Unspecified.template: <arg1> arrested or jailed <arg2> for <arg3> crime at <arg4> place

Justice.ChargeIndict.Unspecified.definition: A government actor charging, accusing, or indicting a person, organization, or GPE of a crime
Justice.ChargeIndict.Unspecified.template: <arg1> charged or indicted <arg2> before <arg3> court or judge for <arg4> crime in <arg5> place

Justice.Convict.Unspecified.definition: A person, organization or GPE entity is convicted whenever that entity has been found guilty of a crime
Justice.Convict.Unspecified.template: <arg1> court or judge convicted <arg2> of <arg3> crime in <arg4> place

Justice.InvestigateCrime.Unspecified.definition: Legal, journalistic, and other investigations of crimes

Justice.ReleaseParole.Unspecified.definition: A release-parole event occurs whenever a state actor (GPE, organization subpart, or person representative) ends its custody of a person entity because the sentence has ended, because the charges are dropped, or because parole has been granted
Justice.ReleaseParole.Unspecified.template: <arg1> court or judge released or paroled <arg2> from <arg3> crime in <arg4> place

Justice.Sentence.Unspecified.definition: A sentence event takes place whenever the punishment, particularly incarceration, for the defendant of a trial event is issued by a state actor
Justice.Sentence.Unspecified.template: <arg1> court or judge sentenced <arg2> for <arg3> crime to <arg4> sentence in <arg5> place

Justice.TrialHearing.Unspecified.definition: A trial event occurs whenever a court proceeding has been initiated for the purposes of determining the guilt or innocence of a person, organization or GPE accused of committing a crime. A hearing event occurs whenever a state actor (GPE, organization subpart, or person representative) officially gathers to discuss some criminal legal matter.
Justice.TrialHearing.Unspecified.template: <arg1> tried <arg2> before <arg3> court or judge for <arg4> crime in <arg5> place

Life.Consume.Unspecified.definition: An person or animal takes a substance into their body

Life.Die.Unspecified.definition: The death of a person or animal
Life.Die.Unspecified.template: <arg1> died at <arg2> place from <arg4> medical issue, killed by <arg3> killer

Life.Illness.Unspecified.definition: A person or animal experiencing physical harm due to sickness or illness
Life.Illness.Unspecified.template: <arg1> has <arg3> sickness or illness at <arg4> place, deliberately infected by <arg2>

Life.Infect.Unspecified.definition: A person or animal is infected with a pathogen
Life.Infect.Unspecified.template: <arg1> was infected with <arg2> from <arg3> at <arg4> place

Life.Injure.Unspecified.definition: The physical injuring of a person or animal
Life.Injure.Unspecified.template: <arg1> was injured by <arg2> using <arg3> in <arg4> body part with <arg5> medical issue at <arg6> place

Medical.Diagnosis.Unspecified.definition: A determination of the disease or medical condition that explains a person's or animal's symptoms and signs
Medical.Diagnosis.Unspecified.template: <arg1> treater diagnosed <arg2> patient with <arg3> symptom for <arg4> medical issue at <arg5> place

Medical.Intervention.Unspecified.definition: Any kind of medical treatment or intervention for a person or an animal, often following a diagnosis of a medical condition
Medical.Intervention.Unspecified.template: <arg1> treater treated <arg2> patient for <arg3> medical issue with <arg4> means at <arg5> place

Medical.Vaccinate.Unspecified.definition: A person or an animal is inoculated against a disease
Medical.Vaccinate.Unspecified.template: <arg1> treater vaccinated <arg2> patient via <arg4> vaccination method for <arg3> medical issue at <arg5> place

Movement.Transportation.Evacuation.definition: The movement of a person or animal (by an agent or via their own effort) from one place to another for evacuation purposes
Movement.Transportation.Evacuation.template: <arg1> transported <arg2> in <arg3> from <arg4> place to <arg5> place

Movement.Transportation.GrantAllowPassag.definition: Explicit mention of granting or allowing entry or exit from a location
Movement.Transportation.GrantAllowPassag.template: <arg4> grants <arg1> entry to <arg6> place from <arg5> place to transport <arg2> using <arg3> vehicle

Movement.Transportation.IllegalTransport.definition: Explicit mention of illegal physical transporting of people or things between places, such as smuggling, trafficking, illegal border crossings
Movement.Transportation.IllegalTransport.template: <arg1> illegally transported <arg2> in <arg3> from <arg4> place to <arg5> place

Movement.Transportation.PreventPassage.definition: Explicit mention of preventing entry or exit from a location
Movement.Transportation.PreventPassage.template: <arg4> prevents <arg1> from entering <arg6> place from <arg5> place to transport <arg2> using <arg3> vehicle

Movement.Transportation.Unspecified.definition: Physical movement or transportation of a person or artifact between places, includes putting and placing objects in locations
Movement.Transportation.Unspecified.template: <arg1> transported <arg2> in <arg3> from <arg4> place to <arg5> place

Personnel.ChangePosition.ChangeJobLocati.definition: A person continuing in the same role in a different location in the same organization
Personnel.ChangePosition.ChangeJobLocati.template: <arg1> changed job locations at <arg2> organization from <arg3> old location of organization to <arg4> new location of organization

Personnel.ChangePosition.Demotion.definition: A person being demoted from a position to a lower position in the same organization
Personnel.ChangePosition.Demotion.template: <arg1> was demoted at <arg2> organization from <arg3> old position to <arg4> new position  in <arg5> place

Personnel.ChangePosition.Lateral.definition: A person changing from one position to another with equal status in the same organization
Personnel.ChangePosition.Lateral.template: <arg1> changed working positions laterally at <arg2> organization from <arg3> old position to <arg4> new position  in <arg5> place

Personnel.ChangePosition.Promotion.definition: A person being promoted from a position to a higher position in the same organization
Personnel.ChangePosition.Promotion.template: <arg1> was promoted at <arg2> organization from <arg3> old position to <arg4> new position  in <arg5> place

Personnel.ChangePosition.Unspecified.definition: A person changing from one position to another in the same organization, with no indication of relative levels of the positions
Personnel.ChangePosition.Unspecified.template: <arg1> changed working positions at <arg2> organization from <arg3> old position to <arg4> new position  in <arg5> place

Personnel.EndPosition.Unspecified.definition: A person stopping working in a position, with no indication that they are changing positions within the same organization
Personnel.EndPosition.Unspecified.template: <arg1> stopped working in <arg3> position at <arg2> organization in <arg4> place

Personnel.StartPosition.Unspecified.definition: A person starting working in a position, with no indication that they are changing positions within the same organization
Personnel.StartPosition.Unspecified.template: <arg1> started working in <arg3> position at <arg2> organization in <arg4> place

Transaction.AidBetweenGovernments.Unspec.definition: A voluntary transfer of resources from one GPE to another from the perspective of governments, often with strings attached
Transaction.AidBetweenGovernments.Unspec.template: <arg1> government gave <arg4> aid to <arg2> government for the benefit of <arg3> at <arg5> place

Transaction.Donation.Unspecified.definition: The voluntary provision, donation, or extension of material aid in the form of assets or commodities (nb: use AidBetweenGovernments instead for GPE to GPE donations)
Transaction.Donation.Unspecified.template: <arg1> gave <arg4> to <arg2> for the benefit of <arg3> at <arg5> place

Transaction.ExchangeBuySell.Unspecified.definition: A transaction transferring or obtaining money, ownership, possession, or control of something, applicable to any type, nature, or method of acquisition including barter
Transaction.ExchangeBuySell.Unspecified.template: <arg1> bought, sold, or traded <arg3> to <arg2> in exchange for <arg4> for the benefit of <arg5> at <arg6> place

ABS.definition: Abstract, non-tangible artifacts such as software (e.g., programs, tool kits, apps, e-mail), measureable intellectual property, contracts, etc. (nb: does not include laws, which are LAW type)

AML.definition: Animal, a non-human living organism which feeds on organic matter, typically having specialized sense organs and a nervous system and able to respond rapidly to stimuli

BAL.definition: A ballot for an election, either the paper ballot used for voting, including both physical paper ballots and also the slate of candidates and ballot questions

BOD.definition: An identifiable, living part of a human's or animal's body, such as a eye, ear, neck, leg, etc.

COM.definition: A tangible product or article of trade for which someone pays or barters, or more generally, an artifact or a thing

FAC.definition: A functional, primarily man-made structure. Facilities are artifacts falling under the domains of architecture and civil engineering, including more temporary human constructs, such as police lines and checkpoints.

GPE.definition: Geopolitical entities such as countries, provinces, states, cities, towns, etc. GPEs are composite entities, consisting of a physical location, a government, and a population. All three of these elements must be present for an entity to be tagged as a GPE. A GPE entity may be a single geopolitical entity or a group.

INF.definition: An information object such as a field of study or topic of communication, including thoughts, opinions, etc.

LAW.definition: A law, an act that is voted on by either a legislative body or an electorate, such as a law, referendum, act, regulation, statute, ordinance, etc.

LOC.definition: Geographical entities such as geographical areas and landmasses, bodies of water

MHI.definition: Any medical condition or health issue, to include everything from disease to broken bones to fever to general ill health, medical errors, even natural causes

MON.definition: A monetary payment. The extent of a Money mention includes modifying quantifiers, the amount, and the currency unit, all of which can be optional.

NAT.definition: Valuable materials or substances, such as minerals, forests, water, and fertile land, that are not man-made, occur naturally within the environment and can be used for economic gain

ORG.definition: Corporations, agencies, and other groups of people defined by an established organizational structure. An ORG entity may be a single organization or a group. A key feature of an ORG is that it can change members without changing identity.

PER.definition: Person entities are limited to humans. A PER entity may be a single person or a group.

PLA.definition: Plants/flora as well as edible fungi such as mushrooms; multicellular living organisms, typically growing in the earth and  lacking the power of locomotion, ex. grass and crops such as wheat, beans, fruit, etc.

PTH.definition: An infectious microorganism or agent, such as a virus, bacterium, protozoan, prion, viroid, or fungus

RES.definition: The results of a voting event.  This will cover general results as well as counted results.

SEN.definition: The judicial or court sentence in a Justice event, the punishment a judge gives to a defendant found guilty of a crime

SID.definition: The different sides of a conflict, such as  philosophical, cultural, ideological, religious, political, guiding philosophical movement or group orientation.  This will encompass sides of the battle/conflict, sports fans when salient, and other such affiliations, in addition to religions, political parties, and other philosophies.

TTL.definition: A persons title or job role

VAL.definition: A numerical value or non-numerical value such as an informational property such as color or make or URL

VEH.definition: A physical device primarily designed to move an object from one location to another, by (for example) carrying, flying, pulling, or pushing the transported object. Vehicle entities may or may not have their own power source.

WEA.definition: A physical device that is primarily used as an instrument for physically harming or destroying entities

Evaluate.Belief.CommittedBelief.definition: Explicit mention of an entity believing with certainty that an event or information object is true
Evaluate.Belief.CommittedBelief.template: <arg1> believes with certainty that <arg2> is true

Evaluate.Belief.NonCommittedBelief.definition: Explicit mention of an entity believing an event or information object is possibly but not necessarily true; they do not have a strong belief in it
Evaluate.Belief.NonCommittedBelief.template: <arg1> believes <arg2> is possibly but not necessarily true

Evaluate.Intent.Intent.definition: Explicit mention of an entity intending a future event or planning or attempting to achieve it
Evaluate.Intent.Intent.template: <arg1> intends, plans for, or attempts <arg2> event

Evaluate.Sentiment.Negative.definition: Negative sentiment held by a person, organization, or GPE toward any knowledge element

Evaluate.Sentiment.Positive.definition: Positive sentiment held by a person, organization, or GPE toward any knowledge element

Evaluate.Status.HoaxFraud.definition: Explicit mentions asserting that an event or a thing is a hoax or fraud
Evaluate.Status.HoaxFraud.template: <arg1> holds that <arg2> is a hoax or a fraud

GeneralAffiliation.ArtifactPoliticalOrga.definition: A side, person, organization, location, or GPE controlling territory.
The affiliation between an artifact (including vehicles, weapons, commodities, etc.) and a GPE.  Artifact-Political-Organization-Religious-Affiliation (APORA).
The ownership or possession of an artifact (including vehicles, weapons, commodities, etc.) by a person, group, or side.  Artifact-Political-Organization-Religious-Affiliation (APORA).
The affiliation between an artifact (including vehicles, weapons, commodities, etc.) and another entity.  Artifact-Political-Organization-Religious-Affiliation (APORA).

GeneralAffiliation.MemberOriginReligionE.definition: The affiliation between a person entity and an ethnicity.  Member-Origin-Religion-Ethnicity (MORE)
The affiliation between a person entity and a GPE.  Member-Origin-Religion-Ethnicity (MORE)
The affiliation between a person entity and another entity.  Member-Origin-Religion-Ethnicity (MORE)

GeneralAffiliation.OrganizationPolitical.definition: The affiliation between an organization entity and a GPE.  Organization-Political-Religious-Affiliation (OPRA)
The affiliation between an organization entity and another entity.  Organization-Political-Religious-Affiliation (OPRA)

GeneralAffiliation.OrganizationWebsite.O.definition: An official top level URL for an organization entitys website

GeneralAffiliation.Sponsorship.Unspecifi.definition: The sponsorship of an event by a one-step removed sponsor (or several steps removed, the man-behind-the-curtain, or more likely the country behind the curtain)

Information.Color.Color.definition: The relation between an entity or thing and a color (string)

Information.Make.Make.definition: The relation between a thing (such as an artifact, vehicle, or weapon) and its make or brand (string)

Measurement.Size.Count.definition: Numerical totals of a countable entity or filler

Measurement.Size.HeightLengthWidth.definition: Numerical value of a dimension of an entity or filler

Measurement.Size.Percentage.definition: Percentage value of an entity or filler (such as results)

Measurement.Size.Unspecified.definition: Numerical value of the size of an entity or filler, not otherwise specified

Measurement.Size.Weight.definition: Numerical value of the weight of an entity or filler

OrganizationAffiliation.EmploymentMember.definition: The relationship between a person and the organization or GPE of which the agent is an employee, or with which the agent has a contractual business or service agreement
The relationship between a person and the organization or GPE of which the agent is an member, or with which the agent has a membership agreement

The relationship between a person and the organization or GPE of which the agent is an employee or member, or with which the agent has a contractual business or service agreement, where the context does not distinguish whether the relationship is employment or membership

OrganizationAffiliation.Founder.Founder.definition: This relation captures a person entity and the organization founded by that person

OrganizationAffiliation.Leadership.Gover.definition: The relationship between a person and a governmental organization or GPE led by that person (who is not the head of state)

OrganizationAffiliation.Leadership.HeadO.definition: The relationship between a person and a country GPE led by that person

OrganizationAffiliation.Leadership.Milit.definition: The relationship between a person and a military or police organization led by that person

OrganizationAffiliation.Leadership.Unspe.definition: The relationship between a person and an organization or GPE led by that person, where the context does not distinguish the nature of the organization

PartWhole.Subsidiary.NationalityCitizen.definition: The ownership, administrative, and other hierarchical relationships between organizations and GPEs, and between governmental organizations and their parent GPE

PartWhole.Subsidiary.OrganizationSubsidi.definition: The ownership, administrative, and other hierarchical relationships between organizations, including relationships between a department within an organization and the organization itself, and between a company and its parent company

PartWhole.Subsidiary.Unspecified.definition: The ownership, administrative, and other hierarchical relationships between organizations and GPEs, where the context does not make it clear whether the parent in the hierarchy is an organization or a GPE

PersonalSocial.Relationship.Political.definition: Otherwise unspecified political relationship between a person and another person

PersonalSocial.Relationship.Unspecified.definition: Otherwise unspecified relationship between a person and another person

PersonalSocial.Role.ProfessionalRole.definition: The relationship between a person and their position or occupation

PersonalSocial.Role.TitleFormOfAddress.definition: The relationship between a person and their title or honorific

PersonalSocial.Role.Unspecified.definition: The relationship between a person and their position, occupation, title, or honorific, where the context does not make it clear whether the role is a position or an honorific

Physical.LocatedNear.Surround.definition: An entity or filler physically surrounding a place

Physical.LocatedNear.Unspecified.definition: The physical location of an entity or filler

Physical.OrganizationHeadquarters.Organi.definition: The relation between the headquarters of an organization and the GPE, LOC, or FAC entity in which the headquarters are located

Physical.Resident.Resident.definition: All GPE, LOC, and FAC entities in which a person entity has lived

ResponsibilityBlame.AssignBlame.AssignBl.definition: An entity blamed for an event

ResponsibilityBlame.ClaimResponsibility..definition: An entity claiming responsibility for an event
